sections.content: The Critical Expert in the Loop principle ensures continuous review by domain specialists. Unlike classical Expert-in-the-Loop, continuous intervention occurs. Every output is validated against domain standards.

items.definition: Digital Humanities developer with domain expertise, technical skills, and prompting competence.

sections.content: CEIL systematically reduces complexity. Example Stefan-Zweig-Digital: Initially proposed multi-user system with database was reduced to single-page application with localStorage.

sections.title: Stefan-Zweig-Digital Intervention
sections.content:
LLM proposal: Multi-user system with PostgreSQL, authentication, role management, cloud deployment

CEIL intervention: Single-page application, localStorage, no server infrastructure

Result: 90% complexity reduction, 100% functionality for actual needs
The intervention directly addresses hallucinations and sycophancy. Outputs are validated against professional standards. False details are identified and corrected. Confirmations are questioned.

sections.title: Core Principle
sections.content: Models tend to generate plausible-sounding but potentially false details. These hallucinations require systematic verification. Additionally, expert validation addresses sycophancy, the documented tendency of LLMs to uncritically confirm user assumptions rather than correct them.
